skill.name: citation-management
skill.description: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers, extract accurate metadata, validate citations, and generate properly formatted BibTeX entries. This skill should be used when you need to find papers, verify citation information, convert DOIs to BibTeX, or ensure reference accuracy in scientific writing.
skill.summary: Comprehensive citation management for academic research. Search Google Scholar and PubMed for papers...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill accesses public scholarly APIs to search and extract citation metadata. No credential file access, environment harvesting, or code execution patterns are present.

content.user_title: Manage citations with accurate BibTeX outputs
content.value_statement: Citations are often incomplete or inconsistent across sources. This skill searches trusted databases, extracts metadata, and validates BibTeX for clean bibliographies.
actual_capabilities: Search PubMed via E-utilities and export JSON or BibTeX
Search Google Scholar using scholarly and export JSON or BibTeX
Convert DOI to BibTeX using doi.org content negotiation
Extract metadata from DOI, PMID, arXiv ID, or URL
Format, sort, and deduplicate BibTeX files
Validate BibTeX fields, years, and DOI formats
limitations: Requires network access to CrossRef, PubMed, arXiv, and doi.org
Google Scholar search needs the scholarly Python library installed
DOI verification depends on external service availability
Outputs are BibTeX or JSON only

use_cases.title: Build a thesis bibliography
use_cases.description: Find papers, convert DOIs to BibTeX, and validate the final reference list.

use_cases.title: Validate PubMed citations
use_cases.description: Search PubMed with MeSH terms and verify citation fields and DOIs.

use_cases.title: Clean shared BibTeX files
use_cases.description: Format and deduplicate a team bibliography before manuscript submission.

prompt_templates.title: Find papers fast
prompt_templates.prompt: Search PubMed for recent CRISPR gene editing reviews from 2021 to 2024 and export results to BibTeX.

prompt_templates.title: Convert DOIs
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert these DOIs to BibTeX and save to refs.bib: 10.1038/s41586-021-03819-2 and 10.1126/science.1258096.

prompt_templates.title: Extract metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract metadata for this list of identifiers from a file and output a clean BibTeX file.

prompt_templates.title: Full cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Format, deduplicate, and validate references.bib with DOI checks, then summarize any high severity errors.

output_examples.input: Validate my BibTeX and tell me what to fix first.
output: Found 3 errors: missing journal field, invalid year, and invalid author separators.
Recommended fixes include adding DOI and page ranges for two entries.

best_practices: Provide precise queries and date ranges for searches
Run formatting and validation after each batch of new citations
Use DOI checks for final submission reviews
anti_patterns: Using Google Scholar search without installing the scholarly dependency
Ignoring validation errors for required fields

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is tool driven and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code environments.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It depends on external APIs and the scholarly library for Google Scholar searches.

faq.question: Can it integrate with LaTeX or Zotero workflows?
faq.answer: It outputs BibTeX files that can be used in LaTeX or imported into reference managers.

faq.question: Does it access my personal files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It only reads files you pass in and does not access credential stores.

faq.question: What should I do if a search fails?
faq.answer: Check network access, API availability, and query syntax, then retry with smaller limits.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual citation entry?
faq.answer: It reduces errors by pulling metadata from authoritative sources and validating required fields.
